div1.p: J'ai l'honneur de vous transmettre ici--jarist un bill présenté par le Sénateur Morgan et qui a pour but la nomination d'un consul Générale et d'un Vice-Consul des États- Unis dans l'État Indépendant du Congo. Ce bill ne pouvait pas devoir être pris en cosidération, la situation étant suffisamment réglée pour le moment par la nomination à Boma d'un agent commercial qui touchera $5000 et aura les mêmes attributions qu'un consul.
Le nouvel agent est sur le point de d'embarquer pour se rendre a son poste.
div1.fw: au Prince de Chimay, Ministre des affaires Étrangères de Belgique, BRUXELLES

div1.p: I have the honor to convey in this letter-- a bill presented by Senator Morgan and concerns the nomination of a consul General and a Vice-Consul of the United States in the Independent State of the Congo. This bill should not be taken into consideration, the situation given sufficiently settled for the moment with the nomination in Boma of a commercial agent who will receive $5000 and will have the same attributions of a consul.
The new agent is about to embark to go to his post.
div1.fw: to the Prince de Chimay, Minister of Foreign Affairs in Belgium, BRUSSELS
div1.ab: In the Senate of the United States
M. Morgan introduced the following bill, which was read trice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations
div1.p: A. Bill for the appointment of consuls to the Congo Free State

Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled that the President shall appoint, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, a Consul General to be acridited to the Congo Free State, in Africa, whose official residence shall be at Boma, or such other place in the Congo Free State as the President may, from time to time, direct, and whose salary shall be four thousand dollars per ammum. , also a Vice-Consul to reside at Banana Point, or at Stanley Pool, as the President may direct, whose slarary shall be two thousand dollars.

See 2. that the President may assign to such consul General the performance of any diplomatic duties that he may consider necessary in connection with the relations of the United States and the Congo Free State without increase of salary and may direct that he shall be under the super- vision of the minister of the United States to the Kingdom of Belgium.
See 3. That the Vice Consul shall be under the upervision of the Cons. gL., and shall report through him to this Gov't, unless the President shall otherwise direct.
